comments.body: why not kubelet/container/testing/runtime_cache.go?  is it because of circular deps?

I'm not sure I understand the question, but yes - this file is here to break circular dependencies. The container tests need to be in a separate package (container_test) because the use `container/testing` files, which in turn depend on `container`. `runtimeCache` is not exported (nor are it's `updateCache` and `pods` methods), so this file "exports" them to the tests. BTW - this follows the pattern used in the go library (e.g. https://golang.org/src/net/http/export_test.go)
Got it.  Will this only viewable to test files?
Yes. Anything named `*_test.go` is only built when testing, and is only visible within directory (otherwise we could just rename all the problematic files to _test.go and be done with it :/ )
This structure breaks when this package is in godeps. See https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/22914
